TopicTitle: What top 10 (or less) mods couldn't you do without?

Articles.Content:
Apologies if this is in the wrong place... kind of a general question rather than a mod forum question (I think?).

I've not had much feedback to work with so I'm really curious as to which mods people consider "must have" so I can implement support for them in my project (which I won't discuss here - see signature banner for info).

So... 

TOP TEN (or fewer) MODS!... GO!

KER (Kerbal Engineer Redux)

[http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/18230-1-0-2-Kerbal-Engineer-Redux-v1-0-16-6](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/18230-1-0-2-Kerbal-Engineer-Redux-v1-0-16-6)

KAC (Kerbal Alarm Clock)

[http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/24786-1-0-x-Kerbal-Alarm-Clock-v3-3-2-1-%28May-21%29](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/24786-1-0-x-Kerbal-Alarm-Clock-v3-3-2-1-%28May-21%29)

Docking Port Alignment Indicator

[http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/43901-1-0-x-Docking-Port-Alignment-Indicator-%28Version-6-2-Updated-05-04-2015%29](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/43901-1-0-x-Docking-Port-Alignment-Indicator-%28Version-6-2-Updated-05-04-2015%29)

Trajectories

[http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/104694-1-0-2-%28FAR-only%29Trajectories-v1-3-0-%282015-05-24%29-atmospheric-predictions](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/104694-1-0-2-%28FAR-only%29Trajectories-v1-3-0-%282015-05-24%29-atmospheric-predictions)

Not a "couldn't do without" but I install them every time:

Chatterer

[http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/92324-1-0-2-Chatterer-v-0-9-5-Talk-to-me-Valentina-!-24-May-2015](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/92324-1-0-2-Chatterer-v-0-9-5-Talk-to-me-Valentina-!-24-May-2015)

Contracts Window +

[http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/91034-1-0-2-Contracts-Window-v5-1-5-1-2015](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/91034-1-0-2-Contracts-Window-v5-1-5-1-2015)

SCANSat

[http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/80369](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/80369)

In no particular order:

[Environmental Visual Enhancements](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/55905) - Clouds, the stock game should have them.

[Distant Object Enhancement](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/98943) - Even more realistic graphics.

[KW Rocketry](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/51037) - More engines, tanks and fairings.

[MechJeb](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/12384) - Manoeuvre planning, automation and technical read-outs.

[Chatterer](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/92324) - Stock is too sterile.

[Active Texture Management](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/59005) - Keeps me under the 3.8GB limit. (Albeit barely.)

[Kerbal Alarm Clock](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/24786) - I'm running multiple missions at once. Without this I'd loose half of them.

Mechjeb, KAC, Tweakscale, Ubizur welding, X Science, KAS, Waypoint Manager, Kerbal Joint Reinforcement (I am sick of game breaking kraken attacks + who likes to place useless struts everywhere just to keep the rocket together... Most essential if you ask me), Texture replacer with 8k planet textures + clouds.

There are many more but these are the ones i think that are essential for me to have as much fun as the game can provide.

None - I usually play pure vanilla stock for the first week or so whenever a new KSP comes out.

However, the first mods I generally install and use the most are the following:

Kerbal Alarm Clock - so I can run multiple missions at once and not miss important events like SOI changes and periapses.

HyperEdit - for Kraken management and the occasional "simulation".

NavBall Docking Alignment Indicator - I prefer this to the more popular windowed one, as I don't need the extra precision and it gives me fewer things to watch while approaching.

Kerbal Engineer - to make sure my latest mothership has enough delta-V, or that my latest Tylo lander has a high enough TWR.

VOID.

Pretty much that. I do use a lot of others, but VOID is a must-have.

Always:

[Kerbal Engineer](http://www.curse.com/ksp-mods/kerbal/222685-kerbal-engineer-redux) - Am I going to go up(ish)?

[Trajectories](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/104694-1-0-2-%28FAR-only%29Trajectories-v1-3-0-%282015-05-24%29-atmospheric-predictions) - Where am I coming down? (Downish is assured)

[Intake Build Aid](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/104704-1-0-2-Intake-Build-Aid) - Prevent asymmetric flame-outs. Vital pre-1.x, apparently *(not entirely convinced)* still useful with 1.0.2.

If I remember on version X:

[Kerbal Alarm Clock](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/24786-1-0-x-Kerbal-Alarm-Clock-v3-3-2-1-%28May-21%29) - Don't oversleep and miss the planet!

[Stock Mod Fix](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/97285-KSP-v1-0-2-Stock-Bug-Fix-Modules-%28Release-v1-0-2d-4-1-Jun-15%29) - Just to remove annoyances

There are 0 mods I literally won't play without. However in order of decreasing desire:

1. [DisableTempGauges](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/116034#DisableTempGauges) (A critical bugfix for 1.0.x so far. Hopefully it'll not be needed soon.)
2. [Stock Bug Fix Modules](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/97285-) (A must install even for those who don't mod their games)
3. [Ambient Light Adjustment](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/71536-) (Needed so my YouTube videos aren't swaths of black)
4. [DefaultThrottle](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/92076-) (Without this mod, my rockets won't launch because 100% is the only correct setting)
5. [Toolbar](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/60863-) (Goes without saying)
6. [Kerbal Engineer Redux](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/18230-) (I won't leave LKO without this mod.
7. [Kerbal Alarm Clock](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/24786-) (I won't go interplanetary without this mod)
8. [PreciseNode](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/47863-) (I won't go interplanetary without this mod either)
9. [Enhanced Navball](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/50524-) (I love being able to offset the navball and make it larger)
10. [TweakableEverything](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/64711-) (Docking ports in staging puts this in the top 10, and then there's all the other stuff)

Edit: I forgot Modulemanager. It's at least as important as the Toolbar mod. Which I realized is more important than the Ambient Light Adjustment mod as that won't work without the Toolbar.

This is hard. Can it be a top 20? ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)
